simple.escp.dom

Class PageFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.escp.dom.PageFormat

  • public class PageFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    PageFormat represent page format section of a template. It will be used to generate initialization ESC/P commands such as selecting line spacing and font size before printing data.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PageFormat.LINE_SPACING
      This enum represents available fixed vertical line spacings.

    • Method Detail

      • setLineSpacing

        public void setLineSpacing(java.lang.String value)
        Set vertical line spacing.
        Parameters:
        value - a String value that can be one of "1/8", "ONE_PER_EIGHT_INCH", "1/6", or "ONE_PER_SIX_INCH".

      • getLineSpacing

        public PageFormat.LINE_SPACING getLineSpacing()
        Get specified vertical line spacing.
        Returns:
        vertical line spacing, by default, it is LINE_SPACING.ONE_PER_SIX_INCH.

      • setCharacterPitch

        public void setCharacterPitch(java.lang.String value)
        Set character pitch (cpi).
        Parameters:
        value - possible value is "5", "6", "10", "12", "17", and "20".

      • getCharacterPitch

        public EscpUtil.CHARACTER_PITCH getCharacterPitch()
        Get specified character pitch (in cpi).
        Returns:
        character pitch, by default, it is CHARACTER_PITCH.CPI_10.

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(java.lang.String value)
        Set font's type face.
        Parameters:
        value - possible value is "roman" or "0" for Roman's type face and "sans-serif" or "1" for Sans serif's type face.

      • setPageLength

        public void setPageLength(java.lang.Integer pageLength)
        Set page length in number of lines.
        Parameters:
        pageLength - number of lines that count as a page.

      • getPageLength

        public java.lang.Integer getPageLength()
        Get specified page length in number of lines.
        Returns:
        number of lines for a page.

      • setPageWidth

        public void setPageWidth(java.lang.Integer pageWidth)
        Set page width in number of characters. You must make sure that this number is within printable area width.
        Parameters:
        pageWidth - number of characters measured from the left-most printable column.

      • getPageWidth

        public java.lang.Integer getPageWidth()
        Get specified page width in number of characters.
        Returns:
        number of characters for a line.

      • setLeftMargin

        public void setLeftMargin(java.lang.Integer leftMargin)
        Set left margin.
        Parameters:
        leftMargin - number of characters measured from the left-most printable column.

      • getLeftMargin

        public java.lang.Integer getLeftMargin()
        Get specified left margin.
        Returns:
        left margin in number of characters measured from the left-most printable column.

      • setRightMargin

        public void setRightMargin(java.lang.Integer rightMargin)
        Set right margin. You must set page width if you want to set right margin because right margin will be calculated based on page width.
        Parameters:
        rightMargin - number of characters before reaching page width.

      • getRightMargin

        public java.lang.Integer getRightMargin()
        Get specified right margin.
        Returns:
        right margin in number of characters before reaching page width.

      • setBottomMargin

        public void setBottomMargin(java.lang.Integer bottomMargin)
        Set bottom margin in number of lines. The bottom margin is calculated as number of lines above top-of-form position of the next page.
        Parameters:
        bottomMargin - number of line above top-of-form position of the next page.

      • getBottomMargin

        public java.lang.Integer getBottomMargin()
        Get specified bottom margin.
        Returns:
        bottom margin in number of lines above top-of-form position of the next page.

      • setAutoLineFeed

        public void setAutoLineFeed(boolean autoLineFeed)
        Use this configuration to tell simple-escp if auto line-feed is enabled or not. If auto line-feed is disabled, all lines will end with CRLF. If auto line-feed is enabled, all lines will end with only CR.
        Parameters:
        autoLineFeed - current auto line-feed status. Default value is false.

      • isAutoLineFeed

        public boolean isAutoLineFeed()
        Get auto line-feed value. Default value is false.
        Returns:
        true if auto line-feed is enabled or false if otherwise.

      • setAutoFormFeed

        public void setAutoFormFeed(boolean autoFormFeed)
        Use this configuration to enable or disable auto form-feed. If this configuration is enabled, CRFF will be appended to the last page. This will cause print position to advance to the top-of-form position of the next page.
        Parameters:
        autoFormFeed - enable or disable auto form-feed. Default value is true.

      • isAutoFormFeed

        public boolean isAutoFormFeed()
        Get auto form-feed value. Default value is true.
        Returns:
        true if auto form-feed is enabled or false if otherwise.

      • isUsePageLengthFromPrinter

        public boolean isUsePageLengthFromPrinter()
        Determine weither to use page length from printer ROM setting or from software configuration.
        Returns:
        true if the effective page length is from printer ROM setting or false if the effective page length is from software configuration.

      • setUsePrinterPageLength

        public void setUsePrinterPageLength(boolean usePageLengthFromPrinter)
        Use this configuration to select weither to use page length setting from printer ROM or from software configuration.
        Parameters:
        usePageLengthFromPrinter - if true, page length from printer ROM will be used or if false, page length from software configuration will be used.

      • build

        public java.lang.String build()
        Build a string that represent ESC/P commands for this page format.
        Returns:
        a string that contains ESC/P commands.
